Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Mosaic Fertilizer agreed to spend approximately $30 million on air pollution controls to eliminate harmful emissions from its sulfuric acid production plant in Uncle Sam, Louisiana. The company also agreed to pay a civil penalty of $2.4 million to resolve alleged Clean Air Act violations.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/sulfuric-acid-manufacturer-agrees-resolve-clean-air-violations

Description: The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) announced a settlement with Mosaic Fertilizer, LLC tol ensure the proper treatment, storage, and disposal of an estimated 60 billion pounds of hazardous waste at six Mosaic facilities in Florida and two in Louisiana.Under the settlement, Mosaic Fertilizer agreed to establish a $630 million trust fund, which would be invested until it reached full funding of $1.8 billion. Mosaic also agreed to also spend $170 million on projects to reduce the environmental impact of manufacturing and waste management programs at its facilities and $2.2 million on two local environmental projects. It also agreed to pay a $5 million civil penalty to the United States and $1.55 million to the State of Louisiana and $1.45 million to the State of Florida, who joined EPA and DOJ as plaintiffs in this case.
Info Source: https://www.epa.gov/enforcement/mosaic-fertilizer-llc-settlement#civil

Description: Mosaic agreed to pay $1.55 million to Louisiana and $1.45 million to Florida to resolve hazardous waste violations. This was part of a larger $810 million settlement involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-mosaic-fertilizer-llc-1
